content:
That's great to hear! Here are some recommendations on artists or genres to check out at world music festivals:

1. Afrobeat: This genre originated in West Africa and combines elements of jazz, funk, and traditional African music. Afrobeat pioneer Fela Kuti is a must-see for fans of the genre.

2. Reggae: Originating in Jamaica, reggae music is known for its laid-back rhythms and socially conscious lyrics. Bob Marley is a legend of the genre, and his music is still popular around the world.

3. Flamenco: Flamenco is a traditional music and dance style from southern Spain, featuring intricate rhythms and passionate vocals. Paco de Lucia and Camaron de la Isla are two of the most famous flamenco artists.

4. Salsa: Salsa music originated in Cuba and has since spread throughout Latin America and the world. The lively rhythms and infectious energy of this genre make it a popular choice for dancing. Check out artists like Celia Cruz and Tito Puente.

5. Taiko: Taiko is a traditional Japanese drumming style that has gained popularity around the world. The powerful rhythms and synchronized movements are a spectacle to see and hear.

6. Gypsy Jazz: Often associated with Belgian-born guitarist Django Reinhardt, gypsy jazz combines the traditional Roma music of eastern Europe with the virtuosic playing of jazz musicians.

These are just a few of the many genres and artists you may encounter at world music festivals. Remember to keep an open mind and enjoy discovering new music!
